CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION myAtoi(s)  
        SET INT_MAX TO two POWERED BY thirty ONE MINUS one  
        SET INT_MIN TO negative two POWERED BY thirty ONE  
        SET result TO zero  
        SET index TO zero  
        SET n TO the LENGTH OF s  
        SET sign TO one  
        WHILE index LESS THAN n AND character at position index OF s EQUALS a single whitespace character  
            INCREMENT index BY one  
        END WHILE  
        IF index LESS THAN n AND (character at position index OF s EQUALS the plus sign OR character at position index OF s EQUALS the minus sign)  
            IF character at position index OF s EQUALS the minus sign  
                SET sign TO negative one  
            ELSE  
                SET sign TO one  
            END IF  
            INCREMENT index BY one  
        END IF  
        WHILE index LESS THAN n AND character at position index OF s IS A DIGIT  
            SET digit TO the INTEGER VALUE OF character at position index OF s  
            IF result GREATER THAN (INT_MAX MINUS digit) DIVIDED BY ten  
                IF sign EQUALS one  
                    RETURN INT_MAX  
                ELSE  
                    RETURN INT_MIN  
                END IF  
            END IF  
            SET result TO result MULTIPLIED BY ten PLUS digit  
            INCREMENT index BY one  
        END WHILE  
        RETURN sign MULTIPLIED BY result  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution
    FUNCTION multiply(num1 string, num2 string) RETURNS string
        IF num1 IS "0" OR num2 IS "0"
            RETURN "0"
        END IF

        DECLARE digits AS MAP from INT to INT
        DECLARE lengthSum AS INT = LENGTH(num1) + LENGTH(num2)
        FOR index IN RANGE(lengthSum)
            digits[index] = 0
        END FOR

        DECLARE reversed1 AS string = ""
        DECLARE reversed2 AS string = ""
        FOR p FROM LENGTH(num1) - 1 DOWNTO 0
            reversed1 = reversed1 + num1[p]
        END FOR
        FOR q FROM LENGTH(num2) - 1 DOWNTO 0
            reversed2 = reversed2 + num2[q]
        END FOR

        DECLARE function recursiveMul(i INT, j INT) RETURNS VOID
            IF i = LENGTH(reversed1)
                RETURN
            END IF
            IF j = LENGTH(reversed2)
                recursiveMul(i + 1, 0)
                RETURN
            END IF

            DECLARE valA AS INT = ASCII_CODE(reversed1[i]) - ASCII_CODE("0")
            DECLARE valB AS INT = ASCII_CODE(reversed2[j]) - ASCII_CODE("0")
            DECLARE product AS INT = valA * valB
            DECLARE baseIndex AS INT = i + j
            DECLARE nextIndex AS INT = baseIndex + 1
            DECLARE totalSum AS INT = product + digits[baseIndex]

            digits[baseIndex] = totalSum MOD 10
            digits[nextIndex] = digits[nextIndex] + (totalSum DIV 10)

            recursiveMul(i, j + 1)
        END FUNCTION

        CALL recursiveMul(0, 0)

        DECLARE output AS string = ""
        FOR key FROM lengthSum - 1 DOWNTO 0
            output = output + TO_STRING(digits[key])
        END FOR

        WHILE LENGTH(output) > 1 AND output[0] = "0"
            output = SUBSTRING(output, 1)
        END WHILE

        RETURN output
    END FUNCTION
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION multiply(num1 string num2 string) RETURNS string  
        IF num1 EQUALS string zero OR num2 EQUALS string zero  
            RETURN string zero  
        END IF  

        SET result TO a list of zeros with the LENGTH OF num1 PLUS the LENGTH OF num2  

        SET num1 TO the reversal of num1  
        SET num2 TO the reversal of num2  

        FOR i FROM zero TO the LENGTH OF num1 MINUS one  
            FOR j FROM zero TO the LENGTH OF num2 MINUS one  
                SET mul TO the character code of the element at position i of num1 MINUS the character code of string zero MULTIPLIED BY the character code of the element at position j of num2 MINUS the character code of string zero  
                SET p1 TO i PLUS j  
                SET p2 TO i PLUS j PLUS one  
                SET sum TO mul PLUS the element at position p1 of result  

                SET the element at position p1 of result TO sum MODULO ten  
                INCREMENT the element at position p2 of result BY the integer division of sum BY ten  
            END FOR  
        END FOR  

        SET result_str TO the concatenation of the string representations of the elements of result in reverse order  
        RETURN result_str with all leading string zeros removed  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION grayCode(n)  
        IF n IS 0 THEN  
            RETURN [0]  
        END IF  
        
        ASSIGN resultList TO grayCode(n - 1)  
        LET bitFlag BE 2 ^ (n - 1) * 1  
        
        DEFINE FUNCTION reverseList(inputList)  
            IF inputList IS EMPTY THEN  
                RETURN []  
            ELSE  
                RETURN reverseList(inputList[1:]) + [inputList[0]]  
            END IF  
        END FUNCTION  
        
        LET reversedResult BE reverseList(resultList)  
        LET extendedList BE []  
        
        FOR each element IN reversedResult DO  
            extendedList = extendedList + [(element BITWISE_OR bitFlag)]  
        END FOR  
        
        RETURN resultList + extendedList  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION grayCode(n)  
        IF n EQUALS zero  
            RETURN a list containing zero  
        END IF  
        SET prev_gray TO the result of calling grayCode with the value of n MINUS one  
        SET mask TO one MULTIPLIED BY two RAISED TO the power of n MINUS one  
        SET current_gray TO concatenation of prev_gray WITH a list constructed by taking each number IN the reversed prev_gray AND applying bitwise OR with mask  
        RETURN current_gray  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution
    FUNCTION evalRPN(tokens)
        INITIALIZE holder WITH an empty list
        SET pos TO 0
        WHILE pos IS LESS THAN LENGTH OF tokens
            SET current TO tokens[pos]
            IF current IN { "+", "-", "*", "/" }
                ASSIGN second TO holder REMOVE LAST ELEMENT
                ASSIGN first TO holder REMOVE LAST ELEMENT
                SWITCH current
                    CASE "+"
                        ADD (first + second) TO holder
                    CASE "-"
                        ADD (first - second) TO holder
                    CASE "*"
                        ADD (first * second) TO holder
                    CASE "/"
                        ASSIGN divisionResult TO first / second
                        IF divisionResult LESS THAN 0 AND divisionResult IS NOT AN INTEGER
                            ADD INTEGER PART OF divisionResult + 1 TO holder
                        ELSE
                            ADD INTEGER PART OF divisionResult TO holder
                        END IF
                END SWITCH
            ELSE
                CONVERT current TO INTEGER AND ADD TO holder
            END IF
            INCREMENT pos BY 1
        END WHILE
        RETURN holder[0]
    END FUNCTION
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION evalRPN(tokens)  
        SET stack TO an empty list  
        FOR each token IN tokens  
            IF token EQUALS one of the symbols plus MINUS MULTIPLY DIVIDE  
                SET b TO the last element removed from stack  
                SET a TO the last element removed from stack  
                IF token EQUALS plus  
                    APPEND a PLUS b TO stack  
                ELSE IF token EQUALS minus  
                    APPEND a MINUS b TO stack  
                ELSE IF token EQUALS multiply  
                    APPEND a MULTIPLIED BY b TO stack  
                ELSE IF token EQUALS divide  
                    APPEND the integer value of a DIVIDED BY b TO stack  
                END IF  
            ELSE  
                APPEND the integer value of token TO stack  
            END IF  
        END FOR  
        RETURN the element at position zero of stack  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION reverseWords(s)  
        DECLARE wordList AS list  
        wordList ← EMPTY LIST  
        DECLARE index AS INTEGER  
        index ← 0  
        WHILE index < LENGTH(s) DO  
            WHILE index < LENGTH(s) AND s[index] = ' ' DO  
                index ← index + 1  
            END WHILE  
            IF index = LENGTH(s) THEN  
                BREAK  
            END IF  
            DECLARE startPos AS INTEGER  
            startPos ← index  
            WHILE index < LENGTH(s) AND s[index] ≠ ' ' DO  
                index ← index + 1  
            END WHILE  
            SET word TO SUBSTRING(s, startPos, index - startPos)  
            APPEND word TO wordList  
        END WHILE  
        DECLARE reversedList AS list  
        reversedList ← EMPTY LIST  
        DECLARE pos AS INTEGER  
        pos ← LENGTH(wordList) - 1  
        WHILE pos ≥ 0 DO  
            APPEND wordList[pos] TO reversedList  
            pos ← pos - 1  
        END WHILE  
        DECLARE result AS STRING  
        result ← ""  
        FOR EACH element IN reversedList DO  
            IF result = "" THEN  
                result ← element  
            ELSE  
                result ← result + " " + element  
            END IF  
        END FOR  
        RETURN result  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution
    FUNCTION countPrimes WITH PARAMETER n
        PROCEDURE markNonPrimes WITH PARAMETERS arr, current, endLimit
            IF current GREATER THAN endLimit THEN
                RETURN
            END IF
            IF arr[current] EQUALS True THEN
                SET factor TO current
                SET composite TO factor MULTIPLIED BY factor
                WHILE composite LESS THAN n DO
                    SET arr[composite] TO False
                    SET composite TO composite PLUS factor
                END WHILE
            END IF
            CALL markNonPrimes WITH arr, current PLUS 1, endLimit
        END PROCEDURE

        IF n LESS OR EQUAL 2 THEN
            RETURN 0
        END IF

        SET primeFlags TO empty list
        SET counter TO 0
        WHILE counter LESS THAN n DO
            ADD True TO primeFlags
            SET counter TO counter PLUS 1
        END WHILE

        SET primeFlags[0] TO False
        SET primeFlags[1] TO False

        SET boundary TO FLOOR(SQRT(n))

        CALL markNonPrimes WITH primeFlags, 2, boundary

        SET totalPrimes TO 0
        SET idx TO 0
        WHILE idx LESS THAN LENGTH(primeFlags) DO
            IF primeFlags[idx] IS True THEN
                SET totalPrimes TO totalPrimes PLUS 1
            END IF
            SET idx TO idx PLUS 1
        END WHILE

        RETURN totalPrimes
    END FUNCTION
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION countPrimes WITH PARAMETER n  
        IF n LESS THAN OR EQUAL TO two  
            RETURN zero  
        END IF  
        SET is_prime TO an empty list  
        FOR index FROM zero TO n MINUS one  
            APPEND True TO is_prime  
        END FOR  
        SET element at position zero of is_prime TO False  
        SET element at position one of is_prime TO False  
        SET limit TO the integer part of the square root of n  
        FOR start FROM two TO limit PLUS one  
            IF element at position start of is_prime EQUALS True  
                SET multiple TO start MULTIPLIED BY start  
                WHILE multiple LESS THAN n  
                    SET element at position multiple of is_prime TO False  
                    INCREMENT multiple BY start  
                END WHILE  
            END IF  
        END FOR  
        SET count TO zero  
        FOR each value IN is_prime  
            IF value EQUALS True  
                INCREMENT count BY one  
            END IF  
        END FOR  
        RETURN count  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution
    FUNCTION numSquares(n)
        DECLARE FUNCTION fillDP(index, dpArray, squareList) RETURNS VOID
            IF index GREATER THAN n
                RETURN
            END IF
            DECLARE pos TO 0
            WHILE pos LESS THAN LENGTH(squareList)
                DECLARE currentSquare TO squareList[pos]
                IF index LESS THAN currentSquare
                    BREAK
                END IF
                IF dpArray[index] GREATER THAN dpArray[index - currentSquare] PLUS 1
                    SET dpArray[index] TO dpArray[index - currentSquare] PLUS 1
                END IF
                INCREMENT pos BY 1
            END WHILE
            CALL fillDP(index PLUS 1, dpArray, squareList)
        END FUNCTION

        DECLARE squareNums TO empty list
        DECLARE count TO 1
        WHILE count * count <= n
            APPEND count * count TO squareNums
            SET count TO count PLUS 1
        END WHILE

        DECLARE dp TO list of size (n + 1) FILLED WITH infinity
        SET dp[0] TO 0

        CALL fillDP(1, dp, squareNums)

        RETURN dp[n]
    END FUNCTION
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION numSquares(n)  
        SET dp TO a list of size n PLUS one FILLED WITH infinite value  
        SET the element at position zero of dp TO zero  
        SET squares TO an empty list  
        SET i TO one  
        WHILE i MULTIPLIED BY i IS LESS THAN OR EQUAL TO n  
            APPEND i MULTIPLIED BY i TO squares  
            INCREMENT i BY one  
        END WHILE  
        FOR i FROM one TO n

                IF i IS LESS THAN square  
                    BREAK the inner loop  
                END IF  
                SET dp at position i TO the smaller value BETWEEN dp at position i AND dp at position i MINUS square PLUS one  
            END FOR  
        END FOR  
        RETURN the element at position n of dp  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

    FUNCTION coinChange(coins, amount)
        ASSIGN amount + 1 TO alpha
        CREATE dp WITH alpha ELEMENTS ALL INITIALIZED TO alpha
        ASSIGN 0 TO dp[0]

            IF index > amount THEN RETURN END IF

            SET cursor TO 0
            WHILE cursor < LENGTH(coins)
                LET delta = index - coins[cursor]
                IF delta >= 0 THEN
                    LET candidate = dp[delta] + 1
                    IF candidate < dp[index] THEN
                        dp[index] = candidate
                    END IF
                END IF
                INCREMENT cursor
            END WHILE

            CALL recurBeta(index + 1)
        END FUNCTION

        CALL recurBeta(1)

        IF dp[amount] != alpha THEN
            RETURN dp[amount]
        END IF

        RETURN -1
    END FUNCTION
END CLASS

CLASS Solution
    FUNCTION frequencySort WITH PARAMETER s
        INITIALIZE tally AS empty map
        FOR each symbol IN s
            IF symbol NOT IN tally THEN
                SET tally[symbol] AS 1
            ELSE
                SET currentCount AS tally[symbol]
                SET increasedCount AS currentCount + 1
                SET tally[symbol] AS increasedCount
            END IF
        END FOR

        INITIALIZE rankingArray AS empty list
        FOR each keyValuePair IN tally
            ADD keyValuePair TO rankingArray
        END FOR

        SET indexCounter AS 0
        WHILE indexCounter < LENGTH(rankingArray)
            SET pivotIndex AS indexCounter
            SET compareIndex AS indexCounter + 1
            WHILE compareIndex < LENGTH(rankingArray)
                IF rankingArray[compareIndex].value > rankingArray[pivotIndex].value THEN
                    SET pivotIndex AS compareIndex
                END IF
                ADD 1 TO compareIndex
            END WHILE
            IF pivotIndex != indexCounter THEN
                SET temporary AS rankingArray[indexCounter]
                SET rankingArray[indexCounter] AS rankingArray[pivotIndex]
                SET rankingArray[pivotIndex] AS temporary
            END IF
            ADD 1 TO indexCounter
        END WHILE

        INITIALIZE outputString AS empty string
        SET pointer AS 0
        WHILE pointer < LENGTH(rankingArray)
            SET currentEntry AS rankingArray[pointer]
            SET charVal AS currentEntry.key
            SET repeatTimes AS currentEntry.value
            SET repeatedSegment AS EMPTY STRING
            SET counterVar AS 0
            WHILE counterVar < repeatTimes
                SET repeatedSegment AS repeatedSegment + charVal
                ADD 1 TO counterVar
            END WHILE
            SET outputString AS outputString + repeatedSegment
            ADD 1 TO pointer
        END WHILE

        OUTPUT outputString
    END FUNCTION
END CLASS

    FUNCTION judgeSquareSum WITH parameter c  
        ASSIGN 0 TO alpha  
        ASSIGN FLOOR OF SQUARE ROOT OF c TO beta

            ASSIGN (gamma * gamma) + (delta * delta) TO epsilon

                CASE epsilon EQUALS c:  
                    RETURN true  
                CASE epsilon LESS THAN c:  
                    RETURN RECURSIVE_CHECK(gamma + 1, delta)  
                DEFAULT:  
                    RETURN RECURSIVE_CHECK(gamma, delta - 1)  
            END SWITCH  
        END FUNCTION  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION judgeSquareSum WITH parameter c  
        SET left TO zero  
        SET right TO integer VALUE OF the SQUARE ROOT OF c  
        WHILE left LESS THAN OR EQUAL TO right holds  
            SET current_sum TO left MULTIPLIED BY left PLUS right MULTIPLIED BY right  
            IF current_sum EQUALS c THEN  
                RETURN true  
            ELSE IF current_sum LESS THAN c THEN  
                INCREMENT left BY one  
            ELSE  
                DECREMENT right BY one  
            END IF  
        END WHILE  
        RETURN false  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution
    FUNCTION minimumDeleteSum(s1, s2)
        DEFINE length_s1 AS LENGTH OF s1
        DEFINE length_s2 AS LENGTH OF s2

        DEFINE matrix dp WITH size [length_s1 + 1][length_s2 + 1], FILLED WITH 0

        INDEX j := 0
        WHILE j < length_s2
            LET dp[0][j + 1] BE dp[0][j] + ASCII_CODE OF s2[j]
            j := j + 1
        END WHILE

        INDEX i := 0
        WHILE i < length_s1
            LET dp[i + 1][0] BE dp[i][0] + ASCII_CODE OF s1[i]
            i := i + 1
        END WHILE

        PROCEDURE fill_matrix(i, j)
            IF i > length_s1 THEN RETURN
            IF j > length_s2 THEN
                fill_matrix(i + 1, 1)
                RETURN
            END IF

            IF s1[i - 1] EQUALS s2[j - 1] THEN
                LET dp[i][j] BE dp[i - 1][j - 1]
            ELSE
                LET left_option BE dp[i - 1][j] + ASCII_CODE OF s1[i - 1]
                LET top_option BE dp[i][j - 1] + ASCII_CODE OF s2[j - 1]
                LET dp[i][j] BE MINIMUM OF left_option, top_option
            END IF

            fill_matrix(i, j + 1)
        END PROCEDURE

        fill_matrix(1, 1)

        RETURN dp[length_s1][length_s2]
    END FUNCTION
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION minimumDeleteSum(s1, s2)  
        SET m TO the LENGTH OF s1  
        SET n TO the LENGTH OF s2  
        
        CREATE a two dimensional list dp WITH dimensions m PLUS one BY n PLUS one INITIALIZED WITH zeroes  
        
        FOR j FROM one TO n  
            SET element at position j of the first row of dp TO element at position j MINUS one of the first row of dp PLUS ASCII value of character at position j MINUS one of s2  
        END FOR  
        
        FOR i FROM one TO m  
            SET element at position i of the first column of dp TO element at position i MINUS one of the first column of dp PLUS ASCII value of character at position i MINUS one of s1  
        END FOR  
        
        FOR i FROM one TO m  
            FOR j FROM one TO n  
                IF character at position i MINUS one of s1 EQUALS character at position j MINUS one of s2  
                    SET element at position i , position j of dp TO element at position i MINUS one , position j MINUS one of dp  
                ELSE  
                    SET element at position i , position j of dp TO the MINIMUM OF element at position i MINUS one , position j of dp PLUS ASCII value of character at position i MINUS one of s1 AND element at position i , position j MINUS one of dp PLUS ASCII value of character at position j MINUS one of s2  
                END IF  
            END FOR  
        END FOR  
        
        RETURN element at position m , position n of dp  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION isBipartite(graph)  
        LET size BE LENGTH OF graph  
        LET marks BE a dictionary WITH KEYS FROM 0 TO size - 1 INITIALIZED TO 0  
        
        FUNCTION dfsCheck(vertex, mark)  
            marks[vertex] = mark  
            LET neighbors BE graph[vertex]  
            
            FOR index FROM LENGTH OF neighbors - 1 DOWNTO 0  
                LET adjacent BE neighbors[index]  
                
                SWITCH marks[adjacent]  
                    CASE mark:  
                        RETURN False  
                    CASE 0:  
                        LET result BE dfsCheck(adjacent, -mark)  
                        IF result == False THEN  
                            RETURN False  
                        END IF  
                END SWITCH  
            END FOR  
            
            RETURN True  
        END FUNCTION  
        
        LET pos BE 0  
        WHILE pos < size  
            IF marks[pos] == 0 THEN  
                IF NOT dfsCheck(pos, 1) THEN  
                    RETURN False  
                END IF  
            END IF  
            pos = pos + 1  
        END WHILE  
        
        RETURN True  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION loudAndRich(richer, quiet)  
        DECLARE graph AS a default dictionary mapping integer keys to sets  
        
        FOR index j FROM 0 TO LENGTH(richer) - 1  
            LET richOne = richer[j][0]  
            LET poorOne = richer[j][1]  
            IF poorOne NOT IN graph THEN  
                graph[poorOne] = EMPTY SET  
            END IF  
            ADD richOne TO graph[poorOne]  
        END FOR  
        
        LET numPersons = LENGTH(quiet)  
        LET res = AN ARRAY OF size numPersons FILLED WITH -1  
        
        FUNCTION traverse(person) RETURNS integer  
            IF res[person] != -1 THEN  
                RETURN res[person]  
            END IF  
            
            res[person] = person  
            IF graph CONTAINS person THEN  
                FOR each adj IN graph[person]  
                    LET contender = traverse(adj)  
                    IF quiet[contender] < quiet[res[person]] THEN  
                        res[person] = contender  
                    END IF  
                END FOR  
            END IF  
            RETURN res[person]  
        END FUNCTION  
        
        FOR k FROM 0 TO numPersons - 1  
            _ = traverse(k)  
        END FOR  
        
        RETURN res  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION carFleet(target position speed)  
        SET paired_list TO the list of elements obtained by pairing each element at each position in position WITH the element at the corresponding position in speed  
        SORT paired_list in order from the greatest element of the first component to the smallest element of the first component

            SET s TO the second component of pair  
            SET time TO target MINUS p DIVIDED BY s  
            APPEND time TO time_to_target  
        END FOR  

        SET fleets TO zero  
        SET current_max_time TO zero  

        FOR each time IN time_to_target  
            IF time GREATER THAN current_max_time  
                INCREMENT fleets BY one  
                SET current_max_time TO time  
            END IF  
        END FOR  

        RETURN fleets  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution
    FUNCTION countTriplets(nums)
        INITIALIZE mapPairs WITH an empty map defaulting to 0
        
        FUNCTION buildPairs(index1, index2)
            IF index1 >= LENGTH(nums) THEN
                RETURN
            ELSE IF index2 >= LENGTH(nums) THEN
                CALL buildPairs(index1 + 1, 0)
                RETURN
            END IF
            
            SET mask TO nums[index1] BITWISE_AND nums[index2]
            SET mapPairs[mask] TO mapPairs[mask] + 1
            CALL buildPairs(index1, index2 + 1)
        END FUNCTION
        
        CALL buildPairs(0, 0)
        
        FUNCTION accumulateCount(position)
            IF position >= LENGTH(nums) THEN
                RETURN 0
            END IF
            
            SET acc TO 0
            FOR EACH pairKey, freq IN mapPairs AS entries
                IF (pairKey BITWISE_AND nums[position]) EQUALS 0 THEN
                    SET acc TO acc + freq
                END IF
            END FOR
            
            RETURN acc + accumulateCount(position + 1)
        END FUNCTION
        
        RETURN accumulateCount(0)
    END FUNCTION
END CLASS

CLASS Solution
    FUNCTION gridIllumination(n, lamps, queries)
        DEFINE rows AS dictionary with default 0
        DEFINE columns AS dictionary with default 0
        DEFINE diagonals AS dictionary with default 0
        DEFINE anti_diagonals AS dictionary with default 0
        DEFINE active_lamps AS empty set

        SET index TO 0
        WHILE index < LENGTH(lamps)
            LET x = lamps[index][0]
            LET y = lamps[index][1]
            IF NOT (x, y) IN active_lamps THEN
                INSERT (x, y) INTO active_lamps
                rows[x] = rows[x] + 1
                columns[y] = columns[y] + 1
                diagonals[x - y] = diagonals[x - y] + 1
                anti_diagonals[x + y] = anti_diagonals[x + y] + 1
            END IF
            index = index + 1
        END WHILE

        SET movement_offsets TO [(-1,0),(-1,1),(0,-1),(0,0),(0,1),(1,-1),(1,0),(1,1)]

        LET output AS empty list

        FOR EACH query_point IN queries DO
            LET a = query_point[0]
            LET b = query_point[1]

            IF rows[a] <= 0 AND columns[b] <= 0 AND diagonals[a - b] <= 0 AND anti_diagonals[a + b] <= 0 THEN
                APPEND 0 TO output
            ELSE
                APPEND 1 TO output
            END IF

            FOR EACH offset IN movement_offsets DO
                LET new_x = a + offset[0]
                LET new_y = b + offset[1]
                IF (new_x, new_y) IN active_lamps THEN
                    REMOVE (new_x, new_y) FROM active_lamps
                    rows[new_x] = rows[new_x] - 1
                    columns[new_y] = columns[new_y] - 1
                    diagonals[new_x - new_y] = diagonals[new_x - new_y] - 1
                    anti_diagonals[new_x + new_y] = anti_diagonals[new_x + new_y] - 1
                END IF
            END FOR
        END FOR

        RETURN output
    END FUNCTION
END CLASS

                ADD the tuple of r and c TO lamp_positions  
                INCREMENT the value at key r in row_count BY one  
                INCREMENT the value at key c in col_count BY one  
                INCREMENT the value at key the subtraction of c from r in diag_count BY one  
                INCREMENT the value at key the sum of r and c in anti_diag_count BY one

    END FUNCTION

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION canConvert WITH PARAMETERS str1 str2  
        SET index TO 0  
        WHILE TRUE  
            IF index GREATER OR EQUAL TO LENGTH(str1)  
                BREAK  
            END IF  
            IF str1[index] NOT EQUALS str2[index]  
                EXIT WHILE  
            END IF  
            SET index TO index + 1  
        END WHILE  
        IF index GREATER OR EQUAL TO LENGTH(str1)  
            RETURN True  
        END IF  

        SET char_mappings TO EMPTY_MAP  
        SET pos TO 0  
        WHILE pos LESS THAN LENGTH(str1)  
            SET first_char TO str1[pos]  
            SET second_char TO str2[pos]  
            IF first_char IN KEYS(char_mappings)  
                IF char_mappings[first_char] IS NOT second_char  
                    RETURN False  
                END IF  
            ELSE  
                ASSIGN char_mappings[first_char] ← second_char  
            END IF  
            SET pos TO pos + 1  
        END WHILE  

        SET unique_targets TO EMPTY_SET  
        FOR EACH character IN str2  
            ADD character TO unique_targets  
        END FOR  
        IF LENGTH(unique_targets) EQUALS 26  
            RETURN False  
        END IF  

        RETURN True  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION minDifficulty(jobDifficulty, d)  
        SET n TO LENGTH OF jobDifficulty  
        IF n LESS THAN d  
            RETURN -1  
        END IF  

        FUNCTION dp(i, d)  
            IF d EQUALS 1  
                RETURN MAXIMUM VALUE IN jobDifficulty FROM INDEX i TO END  
            END IF  

            SET min_difficulty TO infinity  
            SET current_max TO 0  
            FOR j FROM i TO n MINUS d  
                SET current_max TO MAXIMUM OF current_max AND jobDifficulty AT j  
                SET tentative_difficulty TO current_max PLUS dp(j PLUS 1, d MINUS 1)  
                SET min_difficulty TO MINIMUM OF min_difficulty AND tentative_difficulty  
            END FOR  

            RETURN min_difficulty  
        END FUNCTION  

        RETURN dp(0, d)  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION minDifficulty(jobDifficulty, d)  
        SET n TO the LENGTH OF jobDifficulty  
        
        IF n LESS THAN d  
            RETURN negative one  
        END IF  
        
        FUNCTION dp(i, d)  
            IF d EQUALS one  
                RETURN the MAXIMUM value IN the SUBLIST of jobDifficulty from position i TO the END  
            END IF  
            
            SET min_difficulty TO positive infinity  
            SET current_max TO zero  
            
            FOR each j FROM i TO n MINUS d  
                SET current_max TO the GREATER BETWEEN current_max AND element at position j OF jobDifficulty  
                SET candidate TO current_max PLUS dp(j PLUS one, d MINUS one)  
                IF candidate LESS THAN min_difficulty  
                    SET min_difficulty TO candidate  
                END IF  
            END FOR  
            
            RETURN min_difficulty  
        END FUNCTION  
        
        RETURN dp(zero, d)  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution
	TYPE scoreOfStudents(s : STRING, answers : LIST OF INTEGER) : INTEGER
		// Nested helper FUNCTION evaluate_expression
		TYPE evaluate_expression(expression : STRING) : INTEGER
			LET token_list <- NEW LIST OF INTEGER OR CHAR
			LET accumulator <- 0
			
			FOR position FROM 1 TO LENGTH(expression) DO
				LET unit <- SUBSTRING(expression, position, position)
				IF unit >= "0" AND unit <= "9" THEN
					LET digit_value <- (ASCII_VALUE(unit) - ASCII_VALUE("0"))
					LET accumulator <- (accumulator * 10) + digit_value
				ELSE
					APPEND accumulator TO token_list
					APPEND unit TO token_list
					LET accumulator <- 0
				END IF
			END FOR
			APPEND accumulator TO token_list
			
			LET index <- 2
			WHILE index <= SIZE(token_list) DO
				IF token_list[index] == "*" THEN
					LET product_result <- (token_list[index - 1] * token_list[index + 1])
					REMOVE ELEMENTS AT POSITIONS index-1 TO index+1 FROM token_list
					INSERT product_result INTO token_list AT POSITION index-1
				ELSE
					LET index <- index + 1
				END IF
			END WHILE
			
			LET result_value <- token_list[1]
			LET position <- 2
			WHILE position <= SIZE(token_list) DO
				IF token_list[position] == "+" THEN
					LET result_value <- result_value + token_list[position + 1]
				END IF
				LET position <- position + 2
			END WHILE
			
			RETURN result_value
		END TYPE
		
		// Nested helper FUNCTION get_possible_answers
		TYPE get_possible_answers(expression : STRING) : SET OF INTEGER
			IF ALL CHARACTERS OF expression ARE DIGITS THEN
				LET numeric_val <- INTEGER(expression)
				RETURN NEW SET CONTAINING numeric_val
			END IF
			
			LET accumulated_results <- NEW EMPTY SET OF INTEGER
			LET char_pos <- 2
			WHILE char_pos < LENGTH(expression) DO
				IF char_pos MOD 2 == 0 THEN
					LET left_expr <- SUBSTRING(expression, 1, char_pos - 1)
					LET right_expr <- SUBSTRING(expression, char_pos + 1, LENGTH(expression))
					
					LET left_values <- get_possible_answers(left_expr)
					LET right_values <- get_possible_answers(right_expr)
					
					FOR each left_val IN left_values DO
						FOR each right_val IN right_values DO
							LET combined <- 0
							IF expression[char_pos] == "+" THEN
								LET combined <- (left_val + right_val)
							ELSE
								LET combined <- (left_val * right_val)
							END IF
							
							IF combined <= 1000 THEN
								ADD combined TO accumulated_results
							END IF
						END FOR
					END FOR
				END IF
				LET char_pos <- char_pos + 1
			END WHILE
			
			RETURN accumulated_results
		END TYPE
		
		LET actual_answer <- evaluate_expression(s)
		LET possible <- get_possible_answers(s)
		
		LET score_tracker <- 0
		FOR each given_answer IN answers DO
			IF given_answer == actual_answer THEN
				LET score_tracker <- score_tracker + 5
			ELSE IF given_answer IN possible THEN
				LET score_tracker <- score_tracker + 2
			END IF
		END FOR
		
		RETURN score_tracker
	END TYPE
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION scoreOfStudents(s parameter named s AND answers parameter named answers)  
        FUNCTION evaluate_expression(expression parameter named expression)  
            SET tokens TO an empty list  
            SET num TO zero  
            FOR each character IN expression  
                IF character is a digit THEN  
                    SET num TO num MULTIPLIED BY ten PLUS numeric value of character  
                ELSE  
                    APPEND num TO tokens  
                    APPEND character TO tokens  
                    SET num TO zero  
                END IF  
            END FOR  
            APPEND num TO tokens  
            
            SET i TO one  
            WHILE i LESS THAN the LENGTH OF tokens DO  
                IF element at position i of tokens EQUALS the multiplication symbol THEN  
                    SET element at position i MINUS one of tokens TO the product of element at position i MINUS one of tokens MULTIPLIED BY element at position i PLUS one of tokens  
                    REMOVE elements at positions i TO i PLUS two EXCLUSIVE FROM tokens  
                ELSE  
                    INCREMENT i BY one  
                END IF  
            END WHILE  
            
            SET result TO element at position zero of tokens  
            SET i TO one  
            WHILE i LESS THAN the LENGTH OF tokens DO  
                IF element at position i of tokens EQUALS the addition symbol THEN  
                    SET result TO result PLUS element at position i PLUS one of tokens  
                END IF  
                INCREMENT i BY two  
            END WHILE  
            
            RETURN result  
        END FUNCTION  
        
        FUNCTION get_possible_answers(expression parameter named expression)  
            IF expression is composed entirely of digits THEN  
                RETURN a set containing the numeric value of expression  
            END IF  
            
            SET results TO an empty set  
            FOR i FROM one TO the LENGTH OF expression MINUS one MINUS one STEP two DO  
                SET left_results TO the return value of get_possible_answers with substring of expression from position zero TO position i MINUS one  
                SET right_results TO the return value of get_possible_answers with substring of expression from position i PLUS one TO the end  
                FOR each left IN left_results  
                    FOR each right IN right_results  
                        IF element at position i of expression EQUALS the addition symbol THEN  
                            SET result TO left PLUS right  
                        ELSE  
                            SET result TO left MULTIPLIED BY right  
                        END IF  
                        IF result LESS THAN OR EQUAL TO one thousand THEN  
                            ADD result TO results  
                        END IF  
                    END FOR  
                END FOR  
            END FOR  
            RETURN results  
        END FUNCTION  
        
        SET correct_answer TO the return value of evaluate_expression with s as argument  
        SET possible_answers TO the return value of get_possible_answers with s as argument  
        
        SET points TO zero  
        FOR each answer IN answers  
            IF answer EQUALS correct_answer THEN  
                INCREMENT points BY five  
            ELSE IF answer IS IN possible_answers THEN  
                INCREMENT points BY two  
            END IF  
        END FOR  
        
        RETURN points  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

    FUNCTION minimumDifference(nums)  
        SET n TO the LENGTH OF nums DIVIDED BY two  
        SET total_sum TO the SUM OF nums  
        SET target TO total_sum DIVIDED BY two  
        SET min_diff TO positive infinity  
        
        SET left_half TO the first n elements of nums  
        SET right_half TO the elements of nums from position n plus one TO the end  
        
        SET left_sums TO a list containing empty dictionaries repeated n PLUS one times  
        SET right_sums TO a list containing empty dictionaries repeated n PLUS one times  
        
        FOR i FROM zero TO n  
            FOR each combination of i elements IN left_half  
                SET subset_sum TO the SUM OF the current combination  
                IF subset_sum EXISTS AS A KEY IN left_sums at position i  
                    DO NOTHING  
                ELSE  
                    SET the value at key subset_sum IN left_sums at position i TO zero  
                END IF  
                INCREMENT the value at key subset_sum IN left_sums at position i BY one  
            END FOR  
            
            FOR each combination of i elements IN right_half  
                SET subset_sum TO the SUM OF the current combination  
                IF subset_sum EXISTS AS A KEY IN right_sums at position i  
                    DO NOTHING  
                ELSE  
                    SET the value at key subset_sum IN right_sums at position i TO zero  
                END IF  
                INCREMENT the value at key subset_sum IN right_sums at position i BY one

            SET right_values TO the keys of right_sums at position n MINUS i SORTED in ascending order

                IF diff_candidate LESS THAN min_diff  
                    SET min_diff TO diff_candidate  
                END IF  
                
                IF current_sum LESS THAN target  
                    INCREMENT j BY one  
                ELSE IF current_sum GREATER THAN target  
                    DECREMENT k BY one  
                ELSE  
                    RETURN zero  
                END IF  
            END WHILE  
        END FOR  
        
        RETURN min_diff  
    END FUNCTION

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION subStrHash(s string power integer modulo integer k integer hashValue integer) RETURNS string  
        
        FUNCTION val(c character) RETURNS integer  
            DECLARE code integer  
            SET code TO the unicode code of c  
            RETURN (code - the unicode code of 'a') + 1  
        END FUNCTION  

        DECLARE length integer  
        SET length TO LENGTH OF s  
        DECLARE rolling_hash integer  
        SET rolling_hash TO 0  
        DECLARE power_term integer  
        SET power_term TO 1  

        DECLARE idx integer  
        PROCEDURE calcInitialHash(pos integer)  
            IF pos > length - 1 THEN RETURN END IF  
            CALL calcInitialHash(pos + 1)  
            SET rolling_hash TO (rolling_hash + val(s[pos]) * power_term) MOD modulo  
            IF pos < length - 1 THEN  
                SET power_term TO (power_term * power) MOD modulo  
            END IF  
        END PROCEDURE  
        CALL calcInitialHash(length - k)  

        DECLARE starting_pos integer  
        SET starting_pos TO length - k  
        GUARD IF rolling_hash = hashValue THEN RETURN SUBSTRING OF s FROM starting_pos LENGTH k END IF  

        DECLARE highest_pow integer  
        SET highest_pow TO power_term  

        PROCEDURE slideWindow(position integer)  
            GUARD IF position < 0 THEN RETURN END IF  
            SET rolling_hash TO (rolling_hash - val(s[position + k]) * highest_pow) MOD modulo  
            IF rolling_hash < 0 THEN SET rolling_hash TO rolling_hash + modulo END IF  
            SET rolling_hash TO ((rolling_hash * power) MOD modulo + val(s[position])) MOD modulo  

            IF rolling_hash = hashValue THEN  
                SET starting_pos TO position  
            END IF  
            CALL slideWindow(position - 1)  
        END PROCEDURE  
        CALL slideWindow(length - k - 1)  

        RETURN SUBSTRING OF s FROM starting_pos LENGTH k  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION subStrHash(s string power integer modulo integer k integer hashValue integer) RETURNS string  
        FUNCTION val(c character) RETURNS integer  
            RETURN the unicode code of character c MINUS the unicode code of character a PLUS one  
        END FUNCTION  

        SET n TO the LENGTH OF string s  
        SET current_hash TO zero  
        SET p_pow TO one  

        FOR i FROM n MINUS k TO n MINUS one  
            SET current_hash TO current_hash PLUS val(the element at position i of s) MULTIPLIED BY p_pow MODULO modulo  
            IF i LESS THAN n MINUS one  
                SET p_pow TO p_pow MULTIPLIED BY power MODULO modulo  
            END IF  
        END FOR  

        SET start_index TO n MINUS k  
        IF current_hash EQUALS hashValue  
            RETURN the substring from position start_index TO the position one LESS THAN n of s  
        END IF  

        SET p_pow_k_minus_1 TO p_pow  

        FOR i FROM n MINUS k MINUS one DOWN TO zero  
            SET current_hash TO current_hash MINUS val(the element at position i PLUS k of s) MULTIPLIED BY p_pow_k_minus_1 MODULO modulo  
            SET current_hash TO current_hash MULTIPLIED BY power PLUS val(the element at position i of s) MODULO modulo  

            IF current_hash EQUALS hashValue  
                SET start_index TO i  
            END IF  
        END FOR  

        RETURN the substring from position start_index TO the position start_index PLUS k MINUS one of s  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION maximumCost(n, highways, k)  
        CREATE adjacency_list AS a map with default empty list  
        FOR route IN highways  
            LET a = route[0]  
            LET b = route[1]  
            LET fee = route[2]  
            APPEND (b, fee) TO adjacency_list[a]  
            APPEND (a, fee) TO adjacency_list[b]  
        END FOR  

        SET best_value TO negative infinity  

        FUNCTION dfs(current_city, visited_nodes, current_sum, edges_count)  
            IF edges_count IS k THEN  
                IF current_sum > best_value THEN  
                    best_value = current_sum  
                END IF  
                RETURN  
            END IF  

            FOR EACH (next_city, toll_cost) IN adjacency_list[current_city]  
                IF next_city NOT IN visited_nodes THEN  
                    visited_nodes.ADD(next_city)  
                    CALL dfs(next_city, visited_nodes, current_sum + toll_cost, edges_count + 1)  
                    visited_nodes.REMOVE(next_city)  
                END IF  
            END FOR  
        END FUNCTION  

        FOR city_index FROM 0 TO n - 1 DO  
            SET visited_nodes TO new set containing city_index  
            CALL dfs(city_index, visited_nodes, 0, 0)  
        END FOR  

        RETURN best_value  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION maximumCost(n, highways, k)  
        CREATE graph AS a default mapping FROM a key TO a list  
        FOR each city1 city2 toll IN highways  
            APPEND the pair of city2 and toll TO the list in graph at key city1  
            APPEND the pair of city1 and toll TO the list in graph at key city2  
        END FOR  
  
        FUNCTION dfs(city visited cost highways_used)  
            DECLARE max_cost AS nonlocal variable  
  
            IF highways_used EQUALS k THEN  
                SET max_cost TO the greater value BETWEEN max_cost AND cost  
                RETURN  
            END IF  
  
            FOR each neighbor toll IN the list at graph at key city  
                IF neighbor NOT IN visited THEN  
                    ADD neighbor TO visited  
                    CALL dfs WITH neighbor visited cost PLUS toll highways_used PLUS one  
                    REMOVE neighbor FROM visited  
                END IF  
            END FOR  
        END FUNCTION  
  
        SET max_cost TO negative one  
        FOR start_city FROM zero TO n MINUS one  
            SET visited TO a set containing start_city  
            CALL dfs WITH start_city visited zero zero  
        END FOR  
  
        RETURN max_cost  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

    FUNCTION shoppingOffers(price, special, needs)  
        SET special TO an empty list  
        FOR each offer IN the original special list  
            IF the sum of elements at all positions except the last in offer IS GREATER THAN zero AND  
               the last element of offer IS LESS THAN the sum of the product of corresponding elements of price and offer except the last element  
                APPEND offer TO special  
            END IF

CLASS Solution
    FUNCTION areSentencesSimilarTwo(sentence1 sentence1 TO sentence1 OF TYPE list OF strings sentence2 sentence2 TO sentence2 OF TYPE list OF strings similarPairs similarPairs TO similarPairs OF TYPE list OF list OF strings) RETURNS boolean
        IF (sentence1 LENGTH MINUS sentence2 LENGTH) MULTIPLIED BY (sentence2 LENGTH MINUS sentence1 LENGTH) GREATER THAN 0
            RETURN false
        END IF

        INITIALIZE parent TO map WITHOUT ENTRIES

        FUNCTION find(x x TO x) RETURNS x
            VARIABLE currentNode ASSIGNED TO x
            WHILE parent[currentNode] IS NOT EXACTLY currentNode
                SET parent[currentNode] TO parent[parent[currentNode]]
                SET currentNode TO parent[currentNode]
            END WHILE
            RETURN currentNode
        END FUNCTION

        FUNCTION union(x x TO x y y TO y)
            VARIABLE rootA INITIALIZED TO find(x)
            VARIABLE rootB INITIALIZED TO find(y)
            IF rootA IS NOT rootB
                ASSIGN parent[rootB] TO rootA
            END IF
        END FUNCTION

        FOR pairIndex FROM 0 TO (similarPairs LENGTH MINUS 1)
            VARIABLE currPair ASSIGNED TO similarPairs[pairIndex]
            FOR elementPosition FROM 0 TO 1
                VARIABLE candidate ASSIGNED TO currPair[elementPosition]
                IF candidate NOT MEMBER OF parent
                    ASSIGN parent[candidate] TO candidate
                END IF
            END FOR
        END FOR

        FOR pairElement IN similarPairs
            union(pairElement[0] pairElement[1])
        END FOR

        VARIABLE idx ASSIGNED TO 0
        WHILE idx LESS THAN sentence1 LENGTH
            VARIABLE firstWord ASSIGNED TO sentence1[idx]
            VARIABLE secondWord ASSIGNED TO sentence2[idx]

            IF firstWord NOT MEMBER OF parent
                ASSIGN parent[firstWord] TO firstWord
            END IF
            IF secondWord NOT MEMBER OF parent
                ASSIGN parent[secondWord] TO secondWord
            END IF

            IF find(firstWord) IS NOT EQUAL TO find(secondWord)
                RETURN false
            END IF
            INCREMENT idx BY 1
        END WHILE

        RETURN true
    END FUNCTION
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION areSentencesSimilarTwo(sentence1 sentence1 TO sentence1 OF TYPE list OF strings sentence2 sentence2 TO sentence2 OF TYPE list OF strings similarPairs similarPairs TO similarPairs OF TYPE list OF list OF strings) RETURNS boolean  
        IF the LENGTH OF sentence1 NOT EQUALS the LENGTH OF sentence2  
            RETURN false  
        END IF  

        SET parent TO empty dictionary  

        FUNCTION find(x x TO x) RETURNS x  
            IF element at position x of parent NOT EQUALS x  
                SET element at position x of parent TO find(element at position x of parent)  
            END IF  
            RETURN element at position x of parent  
        END FUNCTION  

        FUNCTION union(x x TO x y y TO y)  
            SET rootX TO find(x)  
            SET rootY TO find(y)  
            IF rootX NOT EQUALS rootY  
                SET element at position rootY of parent TO rootX  
            END IF  
        END FUNCTION  

        FOR each pair IN similarPairs  
            FOR each word IN pair  
                IF word NOT IN parent  
                    SET element at position word of parent TO word  
                END IF  
            END FOR  
        END FOR  

        FOR each x y IN similarPairs  
            union(x y)  
        END FOR  

        FOR each w1 w2 IN sentence1 sentence2  
            IF w1 NOT IN parent  
                SET element at position w1 of parent TO w1  
            END IF  
            IF w2 NOT IN parent  
                SET element at position w2 of parent TO w2  
            END IF  
            IF find(w1) NOT EQUALS find(w2)  
                RETURN false  
            END IF  
        END FOR  

        RETURN true  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

    FUNCTION encode(s)  
        FUNCTION get_encoded_length(count, substring)  
            SET count_length TO the LENGTH OF the STRING representation of count  
            SET substring_length TO the LENGTH OF substring  
            RETURN count_length PLUS substring_length PLUS two  
        END FUNCTION  

        FUNCTION dp(i, j)  
            SET substring TO the characters from position i TO position j IN s  
            SET n TO j MINUS i PLUS one  
            IF n LESS THAN five THEN  
                RETURN substring  
            END IF  

            SET shortest TO substring  

            FOR k FROM one TO n DIVIDED BY two  
                SET k_valid TO whether n MODULO k EQUALS zero  
                IF k_valid THEN  
                    SET repeat_count TO n DIVIDED BY k  
                    SET candidate_substring TO the characters from position zero TO position k MINUS one IN substring  
                    SET repeated_candidate TO candidate_substring REPEATED repeat_count TIMES  
                    IF substring EQUALS repeated_candidate THEN

                    SET shortest TO combined  
                END IF  
            END FOR  

            RETURN shortest  
        END FUNCTION  

        RETURN dp(zero, the LENGTH OF s MINUS one)  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION numDistinctIslands2(grid)  
        FUNCTION dfs(x, y, island)  
            IF x LESS THAN zero OR x GREATER THAN OR EQUAL TO the LENGTH OF grid OR y LESS THAN zero OR y GREATER THAN OR EQUAL TO the LENGTH OF element at position zero of grid OR element at position x of grid AT position y EQUALS zero  
                RETURN  
            END IF  
            SET element at position x of grid AT position y TO zero  
            APPEND the PAIR consisting of x AND y TO island  
            CALL dfs WITH x INCREMENTED BY one AND y AND island  
            CALL dfs WITH x DECREMENTED BY one AND y AND island  
            CALL dfs WITH x AND y INCREMENTED BY one AND island  
            CALL dfs WITH x AND y DECREMENTED BY one AND island  
        END FUNCTION

        FUNCTION normalize(island)  
            SET shapes TO an EMPTY list  
            FOR each PAIR dx AND dy IN the LIST of PAIRS consisting of one and one AND one and MINUS one AND MINUS one and one AND MINUS one and MINUS one  
                SET new_island TO an EMPTY list  
                FOR each PAIR x AND y IN island  
                    APPEND the PAIR consisting of x MULTIPLIED BY dx AND y MULTIPLIED BY dy TO new_island  
                END FOR  
                SORT new_island  
                SET min_x TO the MINIMUM x value IN new_island  
                SET min_y TO the MINIMUM y value IN new_island  
                APPEND to shapes the TUPLE of PAIRS where each PAIR consists of element x MINUS min_x AND element y MINUS min_y FOR each PAIR x AND y IN new_island  
            END FOR  
            SET length_of_shapes TO the LENGTH OF shapes  
            FOR i FROM zero TO length_of_shapes MINUS one  
                APPEND to shapes the TUPLE of PAIRS where each PAIR consists of element y AND MINUS element x FOR each PAIR x AND y IN element at position i of shapes  
            END FOR  
            RETURN the MINIMUM element in shapes

                IF element at position i of grid AT position j EQUALS one  
                    SET island TO an EMPTY list  
                    CALL dfs WITH i AND j AND island  
                    ADD the RESULT of normalize called with island TO islands  
                END IF  
            END FOR  
        END FOR  
        RETURN the LENGTH OF islands  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

            CALL dfs WITH x AND y MINUS one AND island  
        END FUNCTION

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION findReplaceString(s string parameter WITH name s indices parameter WITH name indices sources parameter WITH name sources targets parameter WITH name targets)  
        SET replacements TO list CREATED BY arranging TOGETHER elements FROM indices sources AND targets AND SORTED BY elements at first position  
        SET result TO empty list

            END IF  
            SET prev_end TO index PLUS LENGTH OF source  
        END FOR  
        APPEND substring of s FROM position prev_end TO end TO result  
        RETURN string FORMED BY JOINING all elements IN result  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION findReplaceString(s parameter, indices parameter, sources parameter, targets parameter)  
        SET replacements TO list of tuples made of element at same position of indices parameter AND sources parameter AND targets parameter sorted by the first element of each tuple  
        SET result TO empty list  
        SET prev_end TO zero  
        FOR each tuple composed of index variable AND source variable AND target variable IN replacements  
            APPEND substring of s parameter from position prev_end TO position index MINUS one to result  
            IF substring of s parameter from position index TO position index PLUS the LENGTH OF source variable MINUS one EQUALS source variable  
                APPEND target variable TO result  
            ELSE  
                APPEND substring of s parameter from position index TO position index PLUS the LENGTH OF source variable MINUS one TO result  
            END IF  
            SET prev_end TO index PLUS the LENGTH OF source variable  
        END FOR  
        APPEND substring of s parameter from position prev_end TO the end TO result  
        RETURN concatenation of all elements IN result  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

    FUNCTION findDerangement(n)  
        DEFINE modulus = 10^9 + 7  
        
        FUNCTION calc(k, val1, val2)  
            IF k > n THEN  
                RETURN val2  
            ELSE  
                SET temp = (k - 1) * (val1 + val2)  
                SET temp = temp MOD modulus  
                RETURN calc(k + 1, val2, temp)  
            END IF  
        END FUNCTION  
        
        IF n == 1 THEN  
            RETURN 0  
        END IF  
        
        IF n == 2 THEN  
            RETURN 1  
        END IF  
        
        RETURN calc(3, 0, 1)  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION findDerangement(n)  
        SET MODULO TO ten RAISED TO THE POWER OF nine PLUS seven  
        
        IF n EQUALS one  
            RETURN zero  
        END IF  
        
        IF n EQUALS two  
            RETURN one  
        END IF  
        
        SET previous_twice TO one  
        SET previous_once TO zero  
        
        FOR integer i FROM three TO n  
            SET current_value TO integer i MINUS one MULTIPLIED BY the SUM OF previous_once AND previous_twice  
            SET current_value TO current_value MODULO MODULO  
            SET previous_twice TO previous_once  
            SET previous_once TO current_value  
        END FOR  
        
        RETURN previous_once  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS
